) Purpose : This IRM provides general case processing procedures for Exempt Organizations Determinations (EOD) specialists to process determination requests. EOD specialists perform all actions in this manual unless otherwise speciﬁed. (
) Audience : The procedures in this manual apply to all Exempt Organizations (EO) employees processing determination requests. (
) Policy Owner : Director, Exempt Organizations and Government Entities. (
) Program Owner : Exempt Organizations and Government Entities. (
) EO includes two primary operational areas: Rulings and Agreements (R&A) and Examinations. (
) EO Rulings and Agreements (EO R&A) is responsible for issuing determination letters on exempt status, private foundation classiﬁcation, and other determina- tions related to exempt organizations. (

) Campus Support processes the user fee payments in the Letter Information Network and User Fee System (LINUS) and scans the applications/requests into the Modiﬁed EO-EP Determination System (MEDS). MEDS transmits the information to the Employee Plans/ Exempt Organizations Determination System (EDS).

) EO Determinations cases are graded based on the case’s primary activity/ issue and are set based on MEDS Business Rules (IRM
). The Case Assignment Guide (CAG) Case Grading Criteria Matrix, Exhibit
, lists case complexity factors and grade level distinctions to determine the correct case grade. Due to the extensive variety of issues encountered in determina- tion requests, the CAG, Exhibit

, lists common case issues and their case grades. Note: The Case Grading Criteria Matrix is used to evaluate a case’s activities, purposes, and issues for grading purposes. Also, management can review individual cases and change the grade based on the matrix. Secure (

) Secure Messaging (SM), a feature within Taxpayer Digital Correspondence (TDC), is a platform for TE/GE employees to communicate online with their taxpayers. This program is similar to a web-based email service and encrypts ﬁles when transmitting sensitive or conﬁdential tax-related information. Messages sent to or from taxpayers are securely exchanged and can include attachments. See Publication
, Secure Messaging for Tax Exempt and Government Entities, for more information. (
) For all cases with control dates on or after June

, all employees with taxpayer contact must: • introduce TDC SM to the taxpayer and their representative during initial contact and invite them to use it during case processing, • use TDC SM if an eligible taxpayer and their representative accepts invitation by submitting an agreement form (Form

, TE/GE Secure Messaging Taxpayer Agreement Authorization of Disclosure to Desig- nated Users), • document the invitation to use TDC SM and the taxpayer’s and their representative’s response in the CCR, and • as permitted by law, use TDC SM for interacting with the taxpayer and their representative during the case until closure. Note: Be sure to include the appropriate selectable paragraph to advise taxpayers and their representatives of the availability of TDC SM to communicate securely with you. (
) For cases with control dates before June

, if you have already made initial contact, discuss with your manager whether using TDC SM would improve your ability to develop the case and close it more efficiently. If you your manger determine TDC SM would be beneﬁcial, invite the taxpayer and their representative to use TDC SM. (
) When you receive a signed Form
, TE/GE Secure Messaging Taxpayer Agreement Authorization of Disclosure to Designated Users, submit it to the BSP shared mailbox *TEGE TDC Provisioning . (

) Upon case closure, send a message to the taxpayer that you are closing their case. Inform them that future communications within TDC will not be possible for this case. Follow TDC SM case closing procedures. Letter Processing of Exempt

Secure Messaging (SM), a feature within Taxpayer Digital Correspondence (TDC), is a platform for TE/GE employees to communicate online with their taxpayers. This program is similar to a web-based email service and encrypts ﬁles when transmitting sensitive or conﬁdential tax-related information. Messages sent to or from taxpayers are securely exchanged and can include attachments. See Publication 5295, Secure Messaging for Tax Exempt and Government Entities, for more information.

) Expedited handling is granted to applications that meet the criteria in Rev. Proc.

, updated annually. Organizations must include a compelling son for the Service to process their application ahead of others. 7.20 Exempt Organizations Determination Letter Program

Facts • State how formed (corporation, trust, association). • State purposes (normally as stated in the organizing document). • State any governance issues (for example, from the bylaws) that affect exemption and/or classiﬁcation. • Summarize the relevant case facts. (Generally, don’t include correspon- dence dates.) • If the organization has a mix of quali- fying and non-qualifying activities, discuss their relative signiﬁcance, preferably in percentages. • Describe proposed and/or actual income and expenses. Law • Cite the most pertinent law supporting the adverse position as well as any law cited by the organization. (IRM 7.28.4 discusses citation order.) • Cite the Code and regulations verbatim, partially, or paraphrased. • Summarize revenue rulings, revenue procedures, and court cases. Application of law • Describe how the organization’s situation is similar or dissimilar to the situation described in each law citation and explain why the organiza- tion fails to meet the requirements of its request. • If there’s a mix of qualifying and non- qualifying elements, discuss all the activities and describe why the non- qualifying activities cause the organization to fail to meet the re- quirements of its request (for example, non-qualifying activities are substantial, etc.). Organization’s position • Summarize the organization’s reasoning or law it believes is appli- cable to its case, if provided. Our response to their position • Directly address federal law if provided by the organization. • Explain whether the Service agrees or disagrees with the organization’s position (if provided) and why.
